IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: STOP RECORDED ON BODY WORN CAMERA SUBSEQUENT OFFENDER: YES ACCIDENT: NO NARRATIVE: VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1): On 10/26/2023 at approximately 0314 hours, I Trooper (Tpr.) Glessner #7395 of the Maryland State Police College Park Barrack, was traveling South on Interstate 495 (I-495) in the area of Good Luck Road (Rd.). I then observed a vehicle in lane two that appeared to be traveling above the posted speed limit. I began to pace the vehicle at 80 mph in a 55 mph speed zone, for approximately three tenths of a mile. My speedometer is certified and calibrated. While following behind the vehicle, I also observed the drivers side tires cross into lane one approximately three feet. I then activated my emergency equipment and conducted a traffic stop on the vehicle. I identified the vehicle as a white BMW 428I (MD/6CE7581). PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2): At that time, I made contact with the driver who I identified as Evelyn Sarah Zizer (05/11/1986) by her Maryland Drivers License. Zizer advised she was coming from the Black Diamond. In speaking with Zizer I immediately detected a moderate odor of alcoholic beverage emanating from her breath and person through the drivers side window. I noticed Zizers eyes were watery and glassy. I then asked Zizer how much she had to drink and he stated two margaritas. I then asked Zizer when her last drink was, she advised 0230 hours. I then advised Zizer to exit to perform a series of field sobriety tests. At the front of her vehicle, I asked if she had any physical or medical disabilities, Zizer advised that she has an iron deficiency and currently takes iron pills. In speaking with Zizer at the front of her vehicle, I detected a moderate odor of an alcoholic beverage coming from her breath and person. When asked to rate her sobriety level 1-10 (1: Sober 10: Drunk), Zizer replied two. HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS TEST: (6/6 CLUES) The first test I explained to Zizer was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus test. Zizer then stated she understood the test. As I began the test, I observed Zizers pupils were of equal size and her eyes tracked equally. 1. Lack of smooth pursuit- present in both eyes. 2. Distinct and sustained nystagmus at maximum deviation- present in both eyes. 3. Onset of nystagmus prior to 45 degrees- present in both eyes WALK AND TURN TEST: (5/8 CLUES) The next test I conducted with Zizer was the Walk and Turn test. The test was conducted using the paved portion of the shoulder on the roadway that was level and clear of debris. For the instructional portion of the test, Zizer was asked to stand with her right foot in front of her left in a straight line. After Zizer was placed it the starting position placing her right foot in front of her left, I advised her not to move until I instructed her to start. As I was demonstrating the test, Zizer broke heel to toe contact two times. Zizer also started walking before I told her to begin once. I instructed her to go back to the starting position after each time. . After completion of my demonstration Zizer began her first series of steps. WALKING STAGE (FIRST NINE STEPS) Missed heel to toe contact on every step. Steps off line on every step. WALKING STAGE (SECOND NINE STEPS) Missed heelto toe contact on every step. Steps off line on every step. Raises arms on steps 1 and 2. THE TURN- Proper ONE LEG STAND TEST: (3/4 CLUES) Next I explained and demonstrated the One Leg Stand test to Zizer. Upon completion of my demonstration, Zizer advised she understood the test and began by raising her left foot. Raised arms throughout the entirety of the 30 second test. Swayed throughout the entirety of the 30 second test. margin-bottom:11px">Puts foot down multiple times throughout the entirety of the 30 second test. PRELIMINARY BREATH TEST (PBT): I then returned to my vehicle to retrieve my preliminary breath test instrument (PBT). I explained to Zizer the reason for using a PBT and she submitted a breath sample of .086. ARREST: Zizer was then taken into custody at 0337 hours. At that time I placed Zizer in my vehicle. Zizer was then transported to the Maryland State Police College Barrack for further processing. Upon my arrival at the barrack, I advised her of her DR-15 Advice Of Rights by MVA recording and paper copy. After hearing the recording, Zizer agreed to submit to the breath test. The breath test was administered at 0428 hours which revealed a result of .074 grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath. Sergeant J. Smith of the Maryland State Police administered the breath test. After issuing Zizer all the appropriate paperwork and citations, she was then released to a sober driver at the barrack. All events did occur in Prince Georges County, Maryland. Case closed by arrest.
